files.patch:
@@ -127,0 +127,6 @@ + *

+ * The test VM is spawned by the main jtreg VM. The stdout of the test VM is hidden + * unless the Verbose or ReportStdout flag are used. TestFrameworkSocket is used by the parent jtreg + * VM and the test VM to communicate. By sending the prints through the TestFrameworkSocket with the + * parameter stdout set to true, the parent VM will print the received messages to its stdout, making it + * visible to the user.

@@ -888,5 +888,0 @@
-            // Here we are in the test VM, which was spawned by the main jtreg VM. the stdout of the test VM is hidden
-            // unless the Verbose or ReportStdout flag are used. TestFrameworkSocket is used by the parent jtreg
-            // VM and the test VM to communicate. By sending the prints through the TestFrameworkSocket with the
-            // parameter stdout set to true, the parent VM will print the received messages to its stdout, making it
-            // visible to the user.
